DOCNAME: CASE OF KEZER AND OTHERS v. TURKEY
CONCLUSION: Partly inadmissible under Art. 6-1 (civilian judges on state security court and Court of Cassation);Violation of Art. 6-1 (military judge on state security court);Not necessary to examine other admissible complaints under Art. 6;Non-pecuniary damage - finding of violation sufficient;Costs and expenses partial award - Convention proceedings
TEXT: CARDINAL . The applicants were born in DATE , CARDINAL , DATE , DATE and DATE respectively and live in GPE .

CARDINAL . On DATE PERSON , PERSON , PERSON and PERSON were arrested and taken into custody by the Anti - Terror branch of ORG on suspicion of aiding and abetting an illegal organisation . On DATE PERSON was arrested and taken into custody by the same police officers on the same grounds .
CARDINAL . On DATE the applicants were brought before ORG . The court ordered their remand in custody .

CARDINAL . On DATE the public prosecutor at ORG filed a bill of indictment accusing PERSON and PERSON of membership of an illegal organisation and the other applicants of aiding and abetting an illegal organisation . He requested that PERSON and PERSON Öndeş be convicted and sentenced under LAW and LAW no . ORG . In respect of the other applicants , the public prosecutor requested that they be convicted and sentenced under LAW CARDINAL of LAW and LAW no . ORG .

CARDINAL . On DATE ORG convicted the applicants as charged and sentenced PERSON to DATE , PERSON DATE and DATE , PERSON to DATE and DATE and PERSON and PERSON to DATE and CARDINAL months’ imprisonment .
CARDINAL . On DATE ORG quashed the judgment of ORG for non - compliance with procedural rules .

CARDINAL . On DATE ORG convicted the applicants as charged and sentenced PERSON to DATE imprisonment , PERSON to DATE and CARDINAL months’ imprisonment and the other applicants to CARDINAL years’ and QUANTITY months’ imprisonment .
CARDINAL . On DATE ORG held a hearing and upheld the judgment of ORG . On DATE the judgment of ORG was deposited with the registry of ORG .

CARDINAL . The relevant domestic law and practice in force at the material time are outlined in the following judgments : PERSON v. GPE ( no . CARDINAL/CARDINAL , § § DATE , DATE ) and GPE v. GPE ( no . CARDINAL , § § CARDINAL , DATE ) .
CARDINAL . By PERSON no . CARDINAL of DATE , published in the Official journal on DATE , ORG have been abolished .
